title: Grilled Skirt Steak With Mojo Marinade Recipe

Grilled Skirt Steak With Mojo Marinade Recipe

Ingredients
For the Steak:
2
pounds
skirt steak
, trimmed of excess fat (see notes)
2
tablespoons
juice from about 2 limes
, plus 1 extra lime for serving
1/4
cup
juice from 1 orange
1/3
cup
olive oil
4
medium
cloves garlic
, minced
1

ground cumin
Kosher salt
and freshly ground black pepper
1/4

Directions
Place skirt steak a resealable bag and add lime and orange juice, olive oil, garlic, cumin, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Seal and squish around to combine. Place in the refrigerator to marinate at least 1 hour and up to overnight.
Serious Eats / Julia Hartbeck
When ready to cook, remove meat from marinade and pat dry with paper towels. Transfer marinade to a small saucepan and simmer until reduced by half over medium heat.
Serious Eats / Julia Hartbeck
Light one chimney full of charcoal.
When all the charcoal is lit and covered with gray ash, pour out and spread the coals evenly over half of coal grate. Alternatively, set half the burners of a gas grill to high heat. Set cooking grate in place, cover grill and allow to preheat for 5 minutes.
Clean and oil
the grilling grate.
Serious Eats / Julia Hartbeck
Place skirt steak on hot side of grill and cook, flipping occasionally, until well-charred and an instant-read thermometer inserted into their center registers 115°F to 120°F (46°C to 49°C) for medium-rare, about 2 to 4 minutes or 125°F to 130°F (52°C to 54°C) for medium, about 3 to 5 minutes. Transfer steak to a large plate, tent with foil, and allow to rest for 10 minutes.
Serious Eats / Julia Hartbeck
Alternatively, to finish indoors:
Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable or canola oil in a large stainless steel or cast iron skillet over high heat until shimmering. Add steak and cook, turning frequently, until well-browned and an instant-read thermometer inserted into its center reads 115°F to 120°F for medium-rare or 125°F to 130°F for medium. Reduce heat as necessary if steak smokes excessively or starts to burn. Transfer to a wire rack set in a rimmed baking sheet and allow to rest 10 minutes.
Serious Eats / Julia Hartbeck
Slice steak
against the grain
, drizzle with pan sauce and sprinkle with cilantro. Cut extra lime into wedges and serve with steak.
Serious Eats / Julia Hartbeck
Special Equipment
Grill
,
chimney starter
,
instant-read thermometer
Notes
An equivalent weight of flap, hanger, or flank steak can be used in place of skirt steak. This steak can also be prepared indoors. See Step 5 for pan-frying instructions.
